intro: Spigelia mocinoi, commonly known as the Mexican flame bean, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes plants with milky sap and often showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of tubular, red-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
